thread.title: Local roundup: Woodstock Academy field hockey qualifies for 1st state tourney
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Woodstock Academy field hockey qualifies for 1st state tourney

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Woodstock Academy field hockey qualifies for 1st state tourney
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 10:11 PM Updated at 10:11 PM By The Bulletin Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 10:11 PM WATERFORD — For the first time in program history, Woodstock Academy qualified for the CIAC field hockey state tournament with a 2-1 win over Waterford on Thursday. “We’re over the moon,” said Woodstock coach Lauren Gagnon after the win over the Lancers. “I’ve been drilling it into them that it’s a realistic goal, but we always had a mental block. We were a new third- or fourth-year program and I think we finally got over that new program smell.” Hannah Burgess scored in the first half for the Centaurs (7-7, 7-6 Eastern Connecticut Conference) while Kylie Barrows added the game-winner in the second. The Lancers slipped to 3-9-1 overall and 3-8-1 in the league. Stonington 3 NFA 1 STONINGTON — Trinity Lennon scored twice and the Bears clinched the ECC title with their fourth win in a row. Margit Burgess added a goal and an assist for Stonington (11-0-3, 11-0-2). Lexi DeVito scored for NFA (5-6-2, 5-6-2), assisted by Haley Conley. East Lyme 2 Killingly 1 EAST LYME — Alexis Burgess and Kaihley Rafferty scored to lead the Vikings to their fourth win in a row. Cara Bradley picked up an assist and Alex Rose made six saves for East Lyme (11-2-1, 10-2-1 ECC). Alyssa Rainey scored on a penalty stroke for Killingly (10-3-2, 9-2-2). Windham 2 WILLIMANTIC — The Whippets and Falcons denied each other their first victories of the season. Devin Godbout and Kayla Muhammad scored for Windham (0-13-1, 0-11-1 ECC). Milky Dunn and Sophie Reilly had goals for Fitch-Ledyard (0-12-1, 0-10-1). GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Killingly 3 Montville 2 KILLINGLY — Cara Mayhew served up 27 points along with 17 digs, four aces and four blocks to lead the Redgals over the Indians, 21-25, 25-18, 25-18, 23-25, 15-8. Ally Conde added 14 digs, 11 kills and five blocks for Killingly (10-8, 4-4 ECC Medium). Kyndra Dietrich totaled 10 service points, four aces and three kills for Montville (8-10, 4-4). Griswold 3 Bacon 0 JEWETT CITY — Cadey McCormack had 24 digs and seven aces to lead the Wolverines past the Bobcats, 25-13, 25-17, 25-11. Casey Rubino added five aces and four kills for Griswold (9-8). Elizabeth Kowalsky had 25 digs for Bacon Academy (4-16). GIRLS SOCCER Lyman 1 Windham 0 LEBANON — Nicole Bibeau scored in the 52nd minute and the Bulldogs clinched a spot in the Class S state tournament. Page 2 of 2 - Kacie Heath recorded an assist and Amanda Sears made two saves for Lyman (5-6-3, 5-2-2 ECC Small). Emily Tartsinis had nine saves for Windham (2-11, 0-9). Windham Tech 3 Med-Ed Prep 0 WILLIMANTIC — Janna O’Connor scored two of the three first-half goals for the Mighty Tigers in their fourth straight win. Wendy Hernandez also scored and Caitlyn Constant made six saves to earn the shutout for Windham Tech (9-6). Williams 4 Prov. Country Day 0 NEW LONDON — Lucy Burr recorded a hat trick and added an assist to lead the Blues to their third win in a row. Camryn Werbinski also scored and Abby Xenelis had two assists for Williams (6-3-1). WOMEN’S SOCCER UConn 1 Houston 0 STORRS — Samantha McGuire scored in the 89th minute and the No. 11 Huskies edged the Cougars for their sixth straight win. Heidi Druehl assisted on the goal for UConn (15-2, 7-1 American Athletic Conference). FROM WEDNESDAY
